chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dion James Gresham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dion James Gresham is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dion James Gresham was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Dion James Gresham was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 02-22-2016 08:30 am

ADDRESS INFO for Dion James Gresham
Current: 304 S. Winter St., River Falls, WI 54022   (Effective: 12-14-2015)
Prior: 306 W. Johnson Street #1, River Falls, WI 54022

Defendant Dion James Gresham appears via videoconference from Pierce County Jail with Attorney Christopher R. Bub in Court.  ADA Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called at 4:30 p.m.  Includes 15CF254 and 15CM252.  Court advises of charges and penalties.  Defendant understands and waives further reading.  Court advises Defendant of rights, he understands.  Court addresss bond in 15CM252, State requests signature bond of $1,000 w/conditions.  Noting condition in St. Croix Co. bond.  Court orders.  Court addresses bond in 15CF254.  States advises of pattern of behavior and requests $2,000 cash bond.  Atty. Bub objects.  Court orders $5,000 signature bond.  Court advises of right to speedy preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives.  Court finds that Defendant has freely, voluntarially and knowingly waived right to speedy Preliminary Hearing.  PD's office will be representing.  Court sets PH, advises Defendant of conditions of bond.  Defendant confirms address.  Court questions military, non-military.  ADA O'Sullivan notes address provided is same as victim's address.  Defendant provides sister's address.  Court reiterates no contact order on bonds.  Defendant understands.  Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
